pr_title: CB-8923 Introduce a custom JUnit XML Report Listener

timeline.message: CB-8923 Introduce a custom JUnit XML Report Listener

timeline.bodyText: What does status 2 mean? Why 2 exactly?
timeline.author: lnardai

replies.bodyText:
This means ITestResult.FAILURE
Here we have to set the correct test results (status, throwable, type) for test, because of our TestContext is not ITestContext indeed. So our project generates all the errors and related messages as Reporter Output.
replies.author: aszegedi

replies.bodyText: So, can we use the Enum from there, or not a variable that is more descriptive?
replies.author: lnardai

timeline.bodyText: Just asking, would this work correctly with parallel runs since it's static?
timeline.author: lnardai

replies.bodyText: Just checked in the code, it uses ThreadLocal internally.
replies.author: lnardai

replies.bodyText:
Each test method and its respective before and after method is executed in a different thread. This is identified by the ID of the thread that is printed on the console.
You can find some additional details, for example: TestNG parallel execution of tests, classes and suites
replies.author: aszegedi

replies.bodyText:
You were scratcing the ugly truth: After I've tested this out with several threads, I had to realised the original solution wasn't able to get the correct throwable to the given test case. So I've applied the same prefixing as we already have for searchUrl.
So finally not the Reporter caused the issue as rather than custom.results.xml template.
replies.author: aszegedi

replies.bodyText: Here is the test upload for Quanta: https://quanta.infra.cloudera.com/?#/runDetails?gtn=6369877
replies.author: aszegedi

timeline.bodyText:
This will only show the first exception that we encounter in the test, is that correct?
Or we are specifically looking for this type of exceptions among them?
If so this method should be rather, findFirstTestFailException.
timeline.author: lnardai

timeline.bodyText: I think this will require changes in jenkins for all jobs right? or we only use the top level suite name?
timeline.author: lnardai
